title: Specialists enter SA fire ground to determine extent of destruction
abstract: Police and firefighters are still trying to work out exactly how many houses have been lost in a bushfire burning in South Australia. Thirteen houses have now been confirmed as destroyed and specialty teams are entering the fire ground to try to identify others, though it's thought that more than 30 houses may have been lost. As the Federal Government looks at how it spends money trying to mitigate disasters, the South Australian Premier Jay Weatherill says little could have been done to prevent the blaze.

title: Luke Foley elected unopposed as NSW Opposition Leader three months from election
abstract: With less than three months until New South Wales goes to the polls, the Labor opposition has just given itself the Herculean task of acquainting voters with a new, little-known leader. The Labor caucus has today elected Luke Foley to replace John Robertson, who resigned over a letter he'd written on behalf of the Sydney siege gunman. The state's Liberal-led Government retains a commanding lead this election, despite having lost a premier and nine MPs resigning or going to the crossbench as a result of corruption investigations.

title: Eight men presumed dead after cargo ship sinks off the coast of Scotland
abstract: In the world's latest maritime mystery, a large cargo ship, with only its bow visible above the water was seen drifting in seas off the Scottish coast - its crew of eight nowhere to be seen. title: One in 10 people sleeping rough in Melbourne are war veterans
abstract: New research by a Melbourne charity has found that almost one in 10 people who sleep rough in the city each night are Australian war veterans. The homelessness support organisation 'Homeground' says most have served in Iraq or Afghanistan. It wants the federal Department of Veterans Affairs to find secure housing for any returned soldiers, sailors and airmen who have nowhere else to go. But the RSL says many of the veterans suffer from mental illness, or are otherwise unwilling accept help.

title: Adelaide community rallies around fire victims
abstract: As firefighters continue to battle an out of control fire burning near Adelaide, the community is rallying to support those affected. At least 26 homes have been destroyed and hundreds of people have been evacuated at different times over the last four days. Already, more than 800 people have registered to volunteer with the clean up.
